intro: Majorana hortensis, commonly known as sweet marjoram, is an aromatic herb belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its essential oils, rich in compounds like terpinene and camphor, contribute to its distinctive aroma and medicinal properties. It is often used in culinary applications and traditional herbal remedies.
